title: Lynn man charged in kidnapping, murder of older sister
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Smith, 30, pleaded not guilty to murder and kidnapping charges in the death of his sister Michelle Knox.
Prosecutors allege Smith made statements about killing Knox outside an apartment on Newhall Street in Lynn.
Smith, previously charged with various crimes, had pleaded guilty to assault with a dangerous weapon this past July.

title: Patriots captain believes defense showed ‘glimpse of dominance’ vs. Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots captain Harold Landry highlighted a 'glimpse of dominance' in their defense despite a 20-13 loss to Raiders.
Landry contributed significantly with 2.5 sacks and seven pressures, part of New England's investment in defensive free agents.
Despite defensive highlights, the Patriots allowed 362 passing yards and multiple explosive plays against the Raiders.

title: David Andrews believes this was most disappointing part of Patriots’ season-opening loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Andrews expressed disappointment in the Patriots' run game after losing the season opener to the Raiders 20-13.
The Patriots gained only 60 rushing yards on 18 attempts with their key backs not carrying in the second half.
Mike Vrabel cited inefficiency in running plays as a reason for shifting focus to the passing game during the match.

title: Marco Sturm maps out the standard he’s setting for Bruins’ training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marco Sturm will lead his first training camp as Bruins head coach on September 17 at Warrior Ice Arena.
Sturm plans to focus on intensity and accountability to improve the Bruins after a 33-39-10 season.
Sturm's communication style is direct, aiming to build strong relationships with both veterans and new players.

title: Worcester girl testifies against man accused of kidnapping her, throwing her off bridge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Hubert faces charges including attempted murder and aggravated rape after allegedly kidnapping a Worcester girl in 2017.
The girl, now 15, testified against Hubert, detailing events including being strangled and thrown off a bridge into Lake Quinsigamond.
Hubert has pleaded not guilty, and his lawyer expects an acquittal; the trial has been delayed since 2020.

title: Drake Maye doesn’t think he has ‘too much on his plate’ and more from WEEI interview
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots QB Drake Maye defends handling of team workload, downplays concern over learning Josh McDaniels' offensive system.
Maye emphasizes need to reduce turnovers after crucial interception led to Patriots' 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Maye supports Bill Belichick's ban on Patriots scouts at UNC, highlighting Belichick's control over team policy.

title: ‘Game 1 is always the hardest’: Patriots veteran shares perspective on Will Campbell’s debut
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookie tackle Will Campbell struggled in his debut, facing late-game penalties and sacks against the Dolphins.
Veteran lineman Morgan Moses highlighted the challenges of NFL debuts, emphasizing growth and adaptation for rookie players.
The Patriots' offensive line allowed four sacks overall in a 13-point game, continuing last season's scoring struggles.

title: Kayshon Boutte reflects on his forgotten history as an elite prospect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kayshon Boutte was once projected as a first-round pick before an ankle injury affected his college performance.
Boutte recorded six catches for 103 yards in the Patriots' season opener, showing potential seen during his LSU career.
Patriots' coach Mike Vrabel praised Boutte's professionalism and versatility, which boosted his role on the team.

title: Hasbro is relocating its headquarters to Boston’s Seaport
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Hasbro is relocating from Pawtucket, Rhode Island to Boston's Seaport, occupying 265,000 square feet at 400 Summer St.
Approximately 700 Hasbro employees will transition to the new Boston headquarters by the end of 2026.
Massachusetts officials, including Governor Maura Healey and Mayor Michelle Wu, support the move as beneficial for job creation.

title: Wu heads into preliminary election with massive 50-point lead over Kraft
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Michelle Wu leads Josh Kraft by 50 points in Emerson College poll for Boston's mayoral race.
72% of likely voters support Wu, while 22% back Kraft, a significant increase from earlier polls.
Two other candidates, Domingos DaRosa and Robert Cappucci, remain below single-digit support in polls.
